page.title: 05CHENIES VILLAGE.
page.content: In 1954 the Chenies Manor estate was put up for sale, by auction by the Duke of Bedford, who then moved to Woburn Abbey.The Manor House was bought by its present owners, the rest of Chenies was bought by various individuals. Life in Chenies Today: In Chenies there are no shops at all and most people go to Chesham to do their shopping.The last shop closed ten years ago.There are no medical services such as hospitals,doctors or dentists.Most people work out-side the village.Many travel to London and Birmingham. There are three farms,but farm workers come from outside the village.Most of the houses are very old some over 400 years old.With wattle and daub walls and ceilings.The houses are scattered all over the village.There are about 100 houses.
